objects.name: NCSC
objects.description: The UK National Cyber Security Centre authored/published the report and provided YARA rules and analysis.

objects.name: Refresh token storage (Locale)
objects.description: AUTHENTIC ANTICS stores the most recently stolen OAuth 2.0 refresh_token in this registry value under the Outlook logging key.

objects.name: Execution frequency control (Counter)
objects.description: AUTHENTIC ANTICS writes the earliest next time to run the stealer payload (current time + 6 days) to this value to limit execution frequency.

objects.name: Outlook Logging key used by malware
objects.description: Parent registry key used by AUTHENTIC ANTICS to store the Counter and Locale values related to execution control and token storage.

objects.name: COM hijack InprocServer32 for Outlook CLSID
objects.description: Persistence via COM hijacking by replacing the default InprocServer32 path (normally npmproxy.dll) to load Microsoft.Identity64.dll within Outlook.

objects.name: Connectivity check URL
objects.description: Used by AUTHENTIC ANTICS to verify network connectivity before executing the stealer stage. Legitimate Google endpoint; high false-positive potential.

objects.name: Google connectivity domain
objects.description: Legitimate domain contacted by malware to check for network connectivity; inclusion here is for detection context only.

objects.name: Microsoft OAuth 2.0 token endpoint
objects.description: Used by AUTHENTIC ANTICS to redeem access and refresh tokens using stolen authorization codes or stored refresh tokens. Legitimate Microsoft service.

objects.name: Microsoft OAuth domain
objects.description: Legitimate Microsoft login domain abused by AUTHENTIC ANTICS for OAuth authorization and token redemption.

objects.name: Microsoft OAuth 2.0 authorize endpoint
objects.description: Used by AUTHENTIC ANTICS to initiate the OAuth flow and display malicious login prompts to steal credentials and authorization codes.

objects.name: Outlook Web API sendMail endpoint
objects.description: Used by AUTHENTIC ANTICS for exfiltration by sending emails from the victim account to an actor-controlled address using a stolen access token.

objects.name: Outlook API domain
objects.description: Legitimate Outlook domain used by AUTHENTIC ANTICS to exfiltrate data via the sendMail API.

objects.name: Outlook Web API sendMail endpoint (alt domain)
objects.description: Alternate Outlook API URL string present in the stealer payload/YARA; associated with the malware’s use of Outlook Web API. Legitimate domain.

objects.name: Outlook Office 365 domain
objects.description: Legitimate Outlook domain referenced by the malware as a resource/endpoint in OAuth flows and API calls.

objects.name: MSAL broker redirect URI
objects.description: Redirect URI used during OAuth flow which the malware intercepts to capture authorization codes and credentials. Normal for Microsoft Office; used maliciously here.

objects.name: PDB path string in dropper
objects.description: PDB directory path embedded in AUTHENTIC ANTICS dropper samples, referenced in YARA detection; indicative of the malicious build environment, not a victim host path.

objects.name: authentic antics
objects.description: AUTHENTIC ANTICS is a Windows-targeting credential and OAuth 2.0 token-stealing malware that runs inside the Outlook process. It comprises a mixed-mode C++/.NET dropper (Microsoft.Identity64.dll) that decrypts and loads an embedded, environmentally keyed .NET stealer payload (Microsoft.Identity.Client.dll). It persists via COM hijacking by replacing npmproxy.dll’s InprocServer32 with the dropper path and enforces infrequent execution via a registry 'Counter' value (approximately every 6 days). The malware uses extensive defense evasion: heavy string obfuscation; dynamic API resolution; unhooking of ntdll.dll registry APIs; hooking of iertutil.dll’s IEConfiguration_GetBool; and environmental keying (deriving the AES-256 decryption key from MachineGuid/ComputerName and the C: drive volume serial). The stealer presents controlled Outlook login prompts and intercepts Microsoft’s OAuth 2.0 authorization code flow to capture authorization codes, credentials, access tokens, and refresh tokens. It stores a stolen refresh_token in the Outlook Logging registry path and validates/redeems tokens via login.microsoftonline.com /token. Exfiltration occurs by sending an email from the victim’s account to an actor-controlled address via the Outlook REST API (SaveToSentItems=false), with data obfuscated by gzip and RSA (2048-bit). Network communications are exclusively to legitimate services (Microsoft and a Google connectivity check endpoint). A PowerShell script variant mirrors the token retrieval behavior with hardcoded victim credentials. The stealer’s codebase includes Microsoft’s MSAL for .NET (unused) to increase apparent legitimacy.

objects.name: Event Triggered Execution: Component Object Model Hijacking
objects.description: AUTHENTIC ANTICS is persisted via COM Hijacking.

objects.name: Deobfuscate/Decode Files or Information.
objects.description: AUTHENTIC ANTICS encrypts the stealer payload as well as using gzip and RSA to obfuscate exfiltration data.

objects.name: Impair Defenses: Disable or Modify Tools
objects.description: AUTHENTIC ANTICS unhooks registry APIs within ntdll.dll.

objects.name: Execution Guardrails: Environmental Keying
objects.description: The AUTHENTIC ANTICS stealer payload is encrypted with a key derived from victim device specific data.

objects.name: System Binary Proxy Execution
objects.description: AUTHENTIC ANTICS carries out extensive checks to ensure it is running from within the Outlook process.

objects.name: Adversary-in-the-Middle
objects.description: AUTHENTIC ANTICS intercepts requests to Microsoft’s OAuth 2.0 Authorization Server and extracts an authorisation code and credentials.

objects.name: Forced Authentication
objects.description: AUTHENTIC ANTICS directs a pop-up browser window to Microsoft’s OAuth 2.0 Authorization Server which prompts the victim to enter their credentials.

objects.name: Exfiltration Over Web Service
objects.description: AUTHENTIC ANTICS hijacks the victim’s email account to send an email to an actor email address via Outlook’s web API.

objects.name: AUTHENTIC_ANTICS_obfuscated_stack_strings
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule AUTHENTIC_ANTICS_obfuscated_stack_strings {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "This rule detects patterns in how the AUTHENTIC ANTICS dropper
builds strings on the stack."

    strings:
        $stack_string_1 = {8D 50 ?? 8D 48 ?? 8D 78 ?? 8D 42 ?? 44 8D 42 ?? 44 8D 62 ??
44 8D 52 ?? 44 8D 6A } // build obfuscated stack string
        $stack_string_2 = {8D 73 ?? 44 8D 4B ?? 44 8D 53 ?? 44 8D 5B ?? 44 8D 73 ?? 44
8D 7B ??}
        $stack_string_3 = {41 8D 49 ?? 8D 51 ?? 45 8D 41 ?? 45 8D 51 ?? 45 8D 59}

    condition:

    uint16(0) == 0x5A4D and uint32(uint32(0x3C)) == 0x00004550 and all of them

}

objects.name: AUTHENTIC_ANTICS_ntdll_unhooking
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule AUTHENTIC_ANTICS_ntdll_unhooking {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "This rule detects code used in the unhooking of ntdll functions
in the AUTHENTIC ANTICS dropper."

    strings:
        $addr_calc = {48 8B D0 49 2B D4 8B D2 49 03 D6 48 8B 00 48 3B 02} // ntdll
function unhooking calculation logic

    condition:
        uint16(0) == 0x5A4D and uint32(uint32(0x3C)) == 0x00004550 and all of them

}

objects.name: AUTHENTIC_ANTICS_pdb_and_imports
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
import "pe"

rule AUTHENTIC_ANTICS_pdb_and_imports {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "This rule detects the pdb path and imports associated with the
AUTHENTIC ANTICS dropper."

    strings:
        $pdb = "C:\\Users\\user\\Desktop\\outlook4\\bin\\"

    condition:
        uint16(0) == 0x5A4D and uint32(uint32(0x3C)) == 0x00004550 and all of them and
pe.imports("user32.dll","GetClassNameW") and pe.imports("user32.dll","GetParent") and
pe.imports("user32.dll","EnumChildWindows") and
pe.imports("user32.dll","GetWindowTextW") and
pe.imports("user32.dll","GetWindowThreadProcessId")
}

objects.name: AUTHENTIC_ANTICS_iertutil_hook
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.

objects.name: AUTHENTIC_ANTICS_Stealer
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule AUTHENTIC_ANTICS_Stealer {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"

 description = "This rule detects strings present in the AUTHENTIC ANTICS .NET

stealer payload."

    strings:
        $ = "http://www.gstatic.com/generate_204" wide
        $ = "d3590ed6-52b3-4102-aeff-aad2292ab01c" wide
        $ = "https://login.microsoftonline.com/common/oauth2/token" wide
        $ = "https://outlook.office365.com/api/v2.0/me/sendMail" wide
        $ =
"https://login.microsoftonline.com/common/oauth2/authorize?response_type=code+id_token&c
lient_id=d3590ed6-52b3-4102-aeff-aad2292ab01c&redirect_uri=ms-appx-
web%3a%2f%2fMicrosoft.AAD.BrokerPlugin%2fd3590ed6-52b3-4102-aeff-
aad2292ab01c&instance_aware=true&nonce=" wide

web://Microsoft.AAD.BrokerPlugin/d3590ed6-52b3-4102-aeff-aad2292ab01c" wide

$ = "<form method=\"POST\" name=\"hiddenform\" action=\"ms-appx-

    condition:
        (uint16(0) == 0x5A4D) and uint32(uint32(0x3C)) == 0x00004550 and all of them
}

objects.name: NCC Group
objects.description: Credited for providing the AUTHENTIC ANTICS samples to NCSC.

objects.name: Microsoft
objects.description: Owner of the legitimate services abused by the malware, including Microsoft Office, Outlook (on the web), and the OAuth 2.0 Authorization Server at login.microsoftonline.com.

objects.name: Google
objects.description: Provider of the legitimate connectivity check endpoint www.gstatic.com/generate_204 used by the malware to verify network access.

objects.name: Analisi Malware: Authentic Antics
objects.description: This report contains technical analysis and indicators associated with malware. authentic antics.
